intro: Wendlandia psychotrioides, commonly known as the psychotrioides bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, berry-like fruits that are dispersed by animals. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
